content.title: Niramaya Scheme
content.details: NIRAMAYA is the Free Medicines Distribution Scheme of the Govt. of Odisha, implemented since 1st May 2015.
benefits: Access to 20 types of Non-EDL Items
eligibility: Patients who have done registration in the Govt. Hospitals
content.application_process: Registration ---> Consultation with doctor ---> Prescription ---> Receipt of drugs from DDC Counter

faqs.question: How much quantity of drugs can I get at a time?
faqs.answer: A patient can get free drugs as suggested in the prescription. For example, if the prescription is for 7 days, drugs for all 7 days are to be given.

faqs.question: What are the timings for Drug Distribution Counters (DDC)?
faqs.answer: The timing for at least one Drug Distribution Counter (DDC) at all medical colleges, major health institutions, district head quarter hospitals & sub-divisional hospitals is 24 X 7.

faqs.question: Are those availing assistance under OSTF/RSBY/BKKY also eligible to get drugs under Niramaya?
faqs.answer: Yes. Any registered patient claiming for assistance under OSTF/RSBY/BKKY is eligible to get drugs under Niramaya.

faqs.question: Whom do I contact for any grievance related to drugs availability?
faqs.answer: For any grievance related to drugs availability, please contact the authorities at Block Level, Sub-divisional Level, District Level, Tertiary Level Institutions, and State Level.

faqs.question: What is the role of different agencies under Niramaya?
faqs.answer: The roles include supervision by District Health Administration, central procurement by Odisha State Medical Corporation, overall monitoring by Director of Health Services, and supervision by Director of Medical Education and Training.
